intro: Riocreuxia bubalina, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces a milky sap that can be toxic, which is a common feature among members of its family. Riocreuxia bubalina is often found in savannah and woodland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
